title: Rockefeller Brothers Fund records

revision_statements.description: Migrated from Re:discovery to the Archivists' Toolkit by Marisa Hudspeth

finding_aid_title: A Guide to the Rockefeller Brothers Fund records

subnotes.content: The collection has been donated to the Rockefeller Archive Center by RBF.

The collection is arranged in seven Record Groups:

RG 1 Administative and Accounting records

RG 2 Office of the President

RG 3 Project Files

RG 4 Special Studies Project

RG 5 West Africa Program

RG 6  Ramon Magsaysay Awards Foundation

RG 7 Photographs

The Rockefeller Brothers Fund (RBF) was established in 1940 by the five sons of John D. Rockefeller Jr. and Abby Aldrich Rockefeller: John D. 3rd, Nelson A., Laurance S., Winthrop, and David Rockefeller, as a vehicle for the members of the Brothers generation to systematically coordinate their philanthropic giving as well as share consultants, advice, and resources. Its endowment was created through a gift from JDR Jr. in 1951, and a subsequent bequest from his estate in 1960. Abby Rockefeller Mauzé, the eldest sibling and the only daughter of John D. Jr. and Abby Aldrich Rockefeller, joined the RBF Board in 1954.

John D. Rockefeller 3rd served as president of the Fund from its inception until 1956. Other past presidents have included: Nelson A. Rockefeller, 1956-1958; Laurance S. Rockefeller, 1958-1968; Dana S. Creel, 1968-1975; William M. Dietel, 1975-1987; and Colin G. Campbell, 1998-2000.
The collection includes correspondence, reports, memorabilia, grant actions, and other material that document the philanthropic work of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund.

content:
In April 2009, Susie, Kristin, and Bethany moved several boxes of RBF material from Vault 107 to Vault 106. Locations are now as follows:

Unprocessed boxes 272-502 (Vault 106, Units 49-55, Shelves 1-7)
Processed boxes 337-428 (Vault 106, Units 56-57, Shelves 1-5, 4-6)

subnotes.content: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at <extref href="http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php">http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php</extref>
